title: Americans Aren’t Receiving Life-Saving Pfizer COVID Drug: CDC
text: [Professional New York Dancer, 25, Identified as Person Who Died After Eating Mislabeled Supermarket Cookies](https://themessenger.com/news/new-york-dancer-died-eating-mislabeled-stew-leonard-peanut-cookies-orla-baxendale?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=trending_story) Americans Aren’t Receiving Life-Saving Pfizer COVID Drug: CDC Less than 35% of eligible adults with mild COVID infections have received the treatment since it was approved [Hannah Murphy](https://themessenger.com/author/hannah-murphy) A large portion of eligible Americans are not receiving a potentially life-saving medication for COVID-19, according to a Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) report. According to the [report](https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/73/wr/mm7303a2.htm?s_cid=mm7303a2_w), up to 80% of eligible patients are not offered [Paxlovid](https://themessenger.com/health/paxlovid-viral-rebound-one-in-five), a COVID-19 antiviral manufactured by Pfizer and authorized by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) at the end of 2021. These results are reminiscent of prior estimates from the CDC indicating that Paxlovid use among the adult population has been less than 35% since the drug was approved. When Paxlovid first hit the market, experts were optimistic about the [antiviral’s potential](https://themessenger.com/health/flu-antiviral-shortage-treating-flu-at-home-tamiflu-flu-shot) to blunt the impact of COVID-19 in patients who are particularly vulnerable to the virus. President Joe Biden made it the center of his COVID response, launching the “test-to-treat” initiative and speaking its praises at the 2022 State of the Union address. When administered within five days of symptom onset, the antiviral is said to reduce the risk of hospitalization by as much as 51%, according to clinical trial results. Despite Paxlovid’s known benefits, “its utilization has been considerably lower than expected,” the CDC writes. The CDC’s report indicates that nearly half of providers involved in the study didn’t offer their [COVID patients](https://themessenger.com/search?s=covid) Paxlovid because they had only mild symptoms; 23% did not prescribe it because their patients were outside of the standard five day symptom window, while another 23% said their patients lacked symptoms. Around 6% were concerned about drug interactions. [Beyond Paxlovid for covid-19: Scientists are scrambling to make better covid antiviral medications](https://themessenger.com/grid/beyond-paxlovid-for-covid-19-scientists-are-scrambling-to-make-better-covid-antiviral-medications?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [6 Things to Know About Paxlovid, the Anti-COVID Pill](https://themessenger.com/health/covid-pill-paxlovid-prescription-who-can-take-it?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Pfizer Revenue Drops 54% In Q2 as Vaccine and Paxlovid Sales Crash](https://themessenger.com/health/pfizer-revenue-drops-54-in-q2-as-vaccine-and-paxlovid-sales-crash?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Pfizer to Nearly Triple Price of COVID-Fighting Medication](https://themessenger.com/health/pfizer-paxlovid-new-york-city-price?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [FDA Approves Paxlovid as COVID Treatment for Adults](https://themessenger.com/politics/fda-approves-paxlovid-as-covid-treatment-for-adults?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Paxlovid Continues to Be Effective Against Newer COVID Strains: Study](https://themessenger.com/health/paxlovid-continued-effectiveness-against-newer-covid-strains-study?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) The CDC acknowledges that these reports could underestimate how often Paxlovid has been prescribed, but maintain that “the proportion of eligible patients who are not offered an antiviral is still substantial.” This highlights a greater need for more education for both patients and providers about the indications for antiviral treatment, the CDC says.
